DataElement.preferredName: Neoplasm Largest External Pelvic Peritoneal Focus Diameter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text response that represents the diameter of the largest focus originating outside of the pelvic peritoneal region.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neoplasm Largest External Pelvic Peritoneal Focus Diameter
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Greatest in size of those under consideration._Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface._Of or pertaining to the pelvis._Of or pertaining to the peritoneum._Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection._The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Greatest in size of those under consideration.
Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
Of or pertaining to the pelvis.
Of or pertaining to the peritoneum.
Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.: Visible to the naked eye.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Less Than or Equal To 2 Centimeter Gross

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Less Than or Equal To 2 Centimeter Gross
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.: Visible to the naked eye.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Microscopic; too small to be seen except under a microscope.

Concepts.definition: Too small to be seen except under a microscope.
